chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
enumerable__T (nat * nat)

Premises:
enumerable__T = fun X : Type => exists f : nat -> option X, forall x : X, exists n : nat, f n = Some x : Type -> Prop Arguments enumerable__T _%type_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
R_nat_nat = fun n : nat => nth (L_T n) n : nat -> option (nat * nat) Arguments R_nat_nat _%nat_scope
enumerable_enumerable_T : forall X : Type, enumerable (fun _ : X => True) < -> enumerable__T X
count_nat = ex_intro (fun f : nat -> option nat => forall x : nat, exists n : nat, f n = Some x) Some (fun n : nat => ex_intro (fun n0 : nat => Some n0 = Some n) n eq_refl) : enumerable__T nat
split_nth : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (n : nat) (d : A * B), List.nth n l d = (List.nth n (fst (split l)) (fst d), List.nth n (snd (split l)) (snd d))
VectorDef.uncons = fun (A : Type) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)) => (VectorDef.hd v, VectorDef.tl v) : forall (A : Type) (n : nat), VectorDef.t A (S n) -> A * VectorDef.t A n Arguments VectorDef.uncons {A}%type_scope {n}%nat_scope
VectorDef.hd = fun A : Type => @VectorDef.caseS A (fun (n : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n)) => A) (fun (h : A) (n : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A n) => h) : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)), (fun (n0 : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n0)) => A) n v Arguments VectorDef.hd {A}%type_scope {n}%nat_scope
Init.Nat.divmod = fix divmod (x y q u : nat) {struct x} : nat * nat := match x with | 0 => (q, u) | S x' => match u with | 0 => divmod x' y (S q) y | S u' => divmod x' y q u' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat * nat Arguments Init.Nat.divmod (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
VectorDef.tl = fun A : Type => @VectorDef.caseS A (fun (n : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n)) => VectorDef.t A n) (fun (_ : A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n) => t) : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)), (fun (n0 : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n0)) => VectorDef.t A n0) n v Arguments VectorDef.tl {A}%type_scope {n}%nat_scope
ByteVector.of_Bvector = fix of_Bvector (n : nat) : Bvector.Bvector (n * 8) ->...-> ByteVector.ByteVector n Arguments ByteVector.of_Bvector {n}%nat_scope
BinPos.Pos.ggcdn_gcdn : forall (n : nat) (a b : BinNums.positive), fst (BinPos.Pos.ggcdn n a b) = BinPos.Pos.gcdn n a b
VectorDef.t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> Prop), P 0 (VectorDef.nil A) -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n), P n t -> P (S n) (VectorDef.cons A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n), P n t
enumT_nat = {| L_T := fix f (n : nat) : list nat := match n with | 0 => [0] | S n0 => f n0 ++ [S n0] end; cum_T := fun n : nat => ex_intro (fun A : list nat => (fix f (n0 : nat) : list nat := match n0 with | 0 => [0] | S n1 => f n1 ++ [S n1] end) n ++ [S n] = (fix f (n0 : nat) : list nat := match n0 with | 0 => [0] | S n1 => f n1 ++ [S n1] end) n ++ A) [S n] eq_refl; el_T := fun n : nat => ex_intro (fun m : nat => n ∈ (fix f (n0 : nat) : list nat := match n0 with | 0 => [0] | S n1 => f n1 ++ [S n1] end) m) n match n as n...
firstn_cons : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (a : A) (l : list A), firstn (S n) (a :: l) = a :: firstn n l
nth_error_Some_lt : forall (Z : Type) (m : nat) (a : Z) (L : list Z), nth L m = Some a -> m < | L |
nth_error_lt_Some : forall (Z : Type) (m : nat) (L : list Z), m < | L | -> exists a : Z, nth L m = Some a
BinPos.Pos.ggcdn_correct_divisors : forall (n : nat) (a b : BinNums.positive), let '(g, (aa, bb)) := BinPos.Pos.ggcdn n a b in a = BinPos.Pos.mul g aa /\ b = BinPos.Pos.mul g bb
count_bool = ex_intro (fun f : nat -> option bool => forall x : bool, exists n : nat, f n = Some x) (fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => Some true | S _ => Some false end) (fun x : bool => if x as b return (exists n : nat, match n with | 0 => Some true | S _ => Some false end = Some b) then ex_intro (fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => Some true | S _ => Some false end = Some true) 0 eq_refl else ex_intro (fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => Some true | S _ => Some false end = Some false) 1 eq_refl) : enumerable__T bool
BinPosDef.Pos.ggcdn = fix ggcdn (n : nat) (a b : BinNums.positive) {struct n} : BinNums.positive * (BinNums.positive * BinNums.positive) := match n with | 0 => (BinNums.xH, (a, b)) | S n0 => match a with | BinNums.xI a' => match b with | BinNums.xI b' => match BinPosDef.Pos.compare a' b' with | Eq => (a, (BinNums.xH, BinNums.xH)) | Lt => let '(g, (ba, aa)) := ggcdn n0 (BinPosDef.Pos.sub b' a') a in (g, (aa, BinPosDef.Pos.add aa (BinNums.xO ba))) | Gt => let '(g, (ab, bb)) := ggcdn n0 (BinPosDef.Pos.sub a' b') b in (g, (BinPosDef.Pos.add bb (BinNums.xO ab...
split : forall A B : Type, list (A * B) -> list A * list B
Nat.mul_succ_r : forall n m : nat, n * S m = n * m + n
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Decimal.del_tail_int = fun (n : nat) (d : Decimal.int) => match d with | Decimal.Pos d0 => Decimal.Pos (Decimal.del_tail n d0) | Decimal.Neg d0 => Decimal.Neg (Decimal.del_tail n d0) end : nat -> Decimal.int -> Decimal.int Arguments Decimal.del_tail_int _%nat_scope _%dec_int_scope
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
ssrbool.mem_mem : forall (T : Type) (mp : ssrbool.mem_pred T), (ssrbool.mem mp = mp) * (ssrbool.mem (ssrbool.simpl_of_mem mp) = mp) * (ssrbool.mem (ssrbool.PredOfSimpl.coerce (ssrbool.simpl_of_mem mp)) = mp)
Ring_polynom.PSubstL1 : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.PNSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
BinPosDef.Pos.ggcd = fun a b : BinNums.positive => BinPosDef.Pos.ggcdn (BinPosDef.Pos.size_nat a + BinPosDef.Pos.size_nat b) a b : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive * (BinNums.positive * BinNums.positive) Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.ggcd (_ _)%positive_scope
